Class SvgPolyLine

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement

                  dxf2svg.svg.SvgPolyLine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvgSolid
public class SvgPolyLine
extends SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement

This class encapsulates the SVG polyline element.

Version:
2.04 - April 8, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Nested Class Summary
protected  class SvgPolyLine.VertexPoint
          This is a wrapper class for Point that allows the inclusion of a bulge value which is required to perform routine calculations for polylines.

Method Detail

setBulge

public void setBulge(double b)
Sets the vertex's bulge value if any. The bulge is the tangent of 1/4 the including angle of the curved segment so, an arc that covers 180 deg has a bulge of 1 by the following math: tan(180 / 4). Conversely if you have the bulge you can calculate the encompassing arc with this formula: angle = 4 * atan(bulge).

setLineWeight

public void setLineWeight(double lweight)
Sets the line weight of the polyline.

getFill

protected java.lang.String getFill()
This method over-rides the SvgObject.getFill() to test for the default polyline fill value of 'none'. If it finds 'fill:none;' it means that the solid takes the layer's colour attribute. If it is anything else it means that the illustrator has changed the colour value of this object to something other from the value of the layer.

Overrides:
getFill in class SvgGraphicElement
Returns:
String fill:#somenum;
See Also:
SvgObject.getFill(), SvgObject.setFill(java.lang.String)

setClosed

public void setClosed(int c)
Sets the polyline to a closed if DXF object is a closed polyline.

Parameters:
c - Polyline flag (bit-coded); default is 0: 1 = Closed; 128 = Plinegen (polyline code/value pair 70).

setVertex

                      double y)
Sets a vertice of a polyline.

Parameters:
x - double value to populate the Point.y value of an internal Point.
y - double. Both values are supplied by EntityProcessor.

setVertexX

public void setVertexX(double x)
sets the x value of this vertex. This method is intended to allow external implementors to add vertices on the most granular level.

setVertexY

public void setVertexY(double y)
sets the y value of this vertex.This method is intended to allow external implementors to add vertices on the most granular level.

setVertex

public void setVertex(Point linePoint,
                      double bulge)
Sets a vertice of a polyline from a pre-existing Point. This is used by SvgHatch to switch from line mode to polyline mode. This can occur in a HATCH pattern where the expected code describes a line but then we detect a bulge which means, we have to switch streams and create a polyline. It can only happen in the first point of a line because we get a bulge with every point description even if it is 0.0 (no bulge).

As an aside, this would also allow you to convert a line into a polyline without any fuss at all. Make a SvgPolyLine object and just collect all the connected lines together, iterate through them and pass them to SvgPolyLine with this method.

getElementAsPath

public java.lang.String getElementAsPath(boolean fromPreviousPoint)
Returns the description of the polyline as a path in a String format. The boolean parameter has no effect on a polyline because the concatination of points is handled internally.

Overrides:
getElementAsPath in class SvgGraphicElement
See Also:
SvgGraphicElement.getElementAsPath(boolean)

extractPolyLinePoints

protected java.lang.String extractPolyLinePoints()
This method is called by the toString() method where upon it iterates over the Vector container of vertices printing out the results with some formatting for readability in the SVG file.

Returns:
String A formatted series of vertices.

extractPolyLineArcPoints

protected java.lang.String extractPolyLineArcPoints()
This method is called by the toString() method where upon it iterates over the Vector container of vertices and bulge points, printing out the results with some formatting for readability in the SVG file.

Returns:
String A formatted series of vertices.

calculateArc

                                        SvgPolyLine.VertexPoint b)
This method performs the internal calculations for the expression of a polyline arc.

calculateMyUniqueData

protected java.lang.String calculateMyUniqueData()
Performs the unique calculation required to describe this object as an SVG element. Here is an example of an object type changing depending on data. If the polyline is closed it is refered to as a polygon in SVG but if it's open it's a polyline. The same object as far as Dxf2Svg but not at all the same for SVG.

Overrides:
calculateMyUniqueData in class SvgObject
Returns:
String In the case of SvgObject it returns an empty String.

getEndPoint

public Point getEndPoint()
Returns the end point of the polyline. Used in animation to determine if two points share the same space.

Overrides:
getEndPoint in class SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement

getStartPoint

public Point getStartPoint()
Returns the start point of a double ended graphic object, which is usually the Anchor. It is a trivial implementation that duplicates another method but this method will help keep the abstraction clear to the author's intent.

Overrides:
getStartPoint in class SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement
Returns:
Point The anchor point or point of origin for the object.

getAllSegmentPoints

public void getAllSegmentPoints(java.util.Vector points)
This method returns the end points of all the segments in this object. For SvgPolyLine the entire set of intersection points is returned (as references). The method does not alter the contents of the argument vector, but simply adds the points to the end. Start point is added first, end point second.

Overrides:
getAllSegmentPoints in class SvgDoubleEndedGraphicElement
Parameters:
points - A vector for storing the points. If the vector is null the method returns; it is upto the caller to manage this.
